required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of the Efficacy and Safety of PXL770 Versus Placebo After 12 Weeks of Treatment in Patients With NAFLD
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled, Parallel Group Trial to Assess the Efficacy and Safety of PXL770 Versus Placebo After 12 Weeks of Treatment in Patients With NAFLD

brief_summary.textblock: This study will assess the efficacy and safety of 3 doses of PXL770 versus placebo after 12 weeks of treatment.

detailed_description.textblock: The study will be performed in patients with Nonalcoholic Fatty Liver Disease. The primary endpoint will be the assessment of the change in the percentage of liver fat mass (assessed by MRI-PDFF).

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Relative Change in the Percentage of Liver Fat Mass (Assessed by Magnetic Resonance Imaging - Proton Density Fat Fraction [MRI-PDFF]) From Baseline to Week 12/End of Treatment (EOT)
primary_outcome.description: MRI acquisitions were performed at pre-qualified local MRI facilities using qualified and standardized instruments at high field strength (3 T or 1.5T) without oral or intravenous contrast. All acquisitions images were transferred to a central reader vendor for central calculation and measurement of MRI-PDFF using the method of Zhong et al. to estimate water and fat components. A 3 cm2 region of interest (ROI) was placed in each Couinaud segment. Central reading was masked to treatment group, clinical data, study site of origin and timepoint.

primary_outcome.measure: Relative Change in the Percentage of Liver Fat Mass (Assessed by MRI-PDFF) From Baseline to Week 12/End of Treatment (Per Protocol Sensitivity Analysis)
primary_outcome.description: MRI acquisitions were performed at pre-qualified local MRI facilities using qualified and standardized instruments at high field strength (3 T or 1.5T) without oral or intravenous contrast. All acquisitions images were transferred to a central reader vendor for central calculation and measurement of MRI-PDFF using the method of Zhong et al. to estimate water and fat components. A 3 cm2 ROI was placed in each Couinaud segment. Central reading was masked to treatment group, clinical data, study site of origin and timepoint.

primary_outcome.measure: Relative Change in the Percentage of Liver Fat Mass (Assessed by MRI-PDFF) From Baseline to Week 12/End of Treatment (Unstratified Wilcoxon Sensitivity Analysis)
primary_outcome.description: MRI acquisitions were performed at pre-qualified local MRI facilities using qualified and standardized instruments at high field strength (3 T or 1.5T) without oral or intravenous contrast. All acquisitions images were transferred to a central reader vendor for central calculation and measurement of MRI-PDFF using the method of Zhong et al. to estimate water and fat components. A 3 cm2 ROI was placed in each Couinaud segment. Central reading was masked to treatment group, clinical data, study site of origin and timepoint.

primary_outcome.measure: Relative Change in the Percentage of Liver Fat Mass (Assessed by MRI-PDFF) From Baseline to Week 12/End of Treatment (Subgroup Analysis - Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus [T2DM])

All acquisitions images were transferred to a central reader vendor for central calculation and measurement of MRI-PDFF using the method of Zhong et al. to estimate water and fat components. secondary_outcome.measure: Absolute Change in the Percentage of Liver Fat Mass (Assessed by MRI-PDFF) From Baseline to Week 12/End of Treatment
secondary_outcome.description: MRI acquisitions were performed at pre-qualified local MRI facilities using qualified and standardized instruments at high field strength (3 T or 1.5T) without oral or intravenous contrast. All acquisitions images were transferred to a central reader vendor for central calculation and measurement of MRI-PDFF using the method of Zhong et al. to estimate water and fat components. A 3 cm2 ROI was placed in each Couinaud segment. Central reading was masked to treatment group, clinical data, study site of origin and timepoint.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Responders (Relative Reduction of at Least 30% in Liver Fat Mass) at Week 12/End of Treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Responders were defined as patients who achieved a clinically meaningful relative reduction of at least 30% in liver fat mass From baseline to Week 12/EOT as assessed by MRI-PDFF

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Alanine Amino Transferase (ALT) From Baseline to Week 12/End of Treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Blood samples were collected, handled and stored according to the instructions described in the laboratory manual and all measurements were performed at a central laboratory.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Aspartate Amino Transferase (AST) From Baseline to Week 12/End of Treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Blood samples were collected, handled and stored according to the instructions described in the laboratory manual and all measurements were performed at a central laboratory.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Fasting Plasma Glucose (FPG) From Baseline to Week12/End of Treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Glycated Hemoglobin (HbA1c) From Baseline to Week12/End of Treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Blood samples were collected, handled and stored according to the instructions described in the laboratory manual and all measurements were performed at a central laboratory.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Total Cholesterol From Baseline to Week12/End of Treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Blood samples were collected, handled and stored according to the instructions described in the laboratory manual and all measurements were performed at a central laboratory.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in High Density Lipoprotein-Cholesterol (HDL-C) From Baseline to Week12/End of Treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Blood samples were collected, handled and stored according to the instructions described in the laboratory manual and all measurements were performed at a central laboratory.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Low Density Lipoprotein-Cholesterol (LDL-C) From Baseline to Week12/End of Treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Blood samples were collected, handled and stored according to the instructions described in the laboratory manual and all measurements were performed at a central laboratory.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Triglycerides From Baseline to Week12/End of Treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Blood samples were collected, handled and stored according to the instructions described in the laboratory manual and all measurements were performed at a central laboratory.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Fibrosis-4 (Fib-4) Score From Baseline to Week 12/End of Treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Fib-4 score is a non invasive method based on clinical determinations that indicates the level of fibrosis/ scarring of the liver. The set cutoffs for this scoring are: Fib-4 < 1.45: absence of cirrhosis; Fib-4 between 1.45 - 3.25: inconclusive and Fib-4 > 3.25: cirrhosis. Fib-4 score was calculated as (Age [years] × AST [U/L]) / (platelet [10^9/L] × √[ALT [U/L]]). Blood samples used for AST, ALT and platelet counts were collected, handled and stored according to the instructions described in the laboratory manual and all measurements were performed at a central laboratory.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Body Weight From Baseline to Week 12/End of Treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Body weight was measured using a scale with appropriate resolution, placed on a stable, flat surface. Shoes, bulky layers of clothing, and jackets had to be removed so that only light clothing remained.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients have given written informed consent
- Body mass index (BMI) ≥ 25 to ≤ 50 kg/m²
- For patients with type 2 diabetes mellitus: either naive of glucose lowering drug or under stable oral glucose lowering drug
- Estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) ≥ 60 mL/[min*1.73m²]
- Alanine amino transferase (ALT) > 20 IU/L in females and > 30 IU/L in males
- Hepatic steatosis (MRI-PDFF ≥ 10%)
- Effective contraception for women of child bearing potential
Exclusion Criteria:
- Evidence of another form of liver disease
- Evidence of liver cirrhosis
- Evidence of hepatic impairment
- Positive serologic evidence of current infectious liver disease
- History of excessive alcohol intake
- Acute cardiovascular disease with 24 weeks prior to screening
- Uncontrolled high blood pressure
- Any disease which in the Investigator's opinion which in the Investigator's opinion would exclude the patient from the study
- Use of non-permitted concomitant medication
- Pregnancy or lactation

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Patients were screened for the study at 15 sites in the United States between 29Mar19 and 13Mar20.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Following a Screening period of maximum 2 weeks, eligible participants entered in a single-blind placebo Run-in period of 4 weeks. This Run-in period was set to reduce any bias regarding placebo effect, to assess patient compliance, and to minimize the possible confounding influence of dietary and activity changes. Only participants who have met all the applicable Inclusion criteria and none of the Exclusion criteria at the end the Run-in period were to be randomized.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Placebo: Oral capsule Two capsules were taken BID with a glass of water at least 15 minutes before a meal in the morning and in the evening time for 12 weeks

group.title: PXL770 250 mg QD
group.description: PXL770 250 mg: Oral capsule Placebo: Oral capsule Two capsules were taken BID with a glass of water at least 15 minutes before a meal in the morning and in the evening time for 12 weeks: 1 capsule of PXL770 250 mg + 1 capsule of placebo in the morning 2 capsules of placebo in the evening

group.title: PXL770 250 mg BID
group.description: PXL770 250 mg: Oral capsule Placebo: Oral capsule Two capsules were taken BID with a glass of water at least 15 minutes before a meal in the morning and in the evening time for 12 weeks: 1 capsule of PXL770 250 mg + 1 capsule of placebo in the morning 1 capsule of PXL770 250 mg + 1 capsule of placebo in the evening

group.title: PXL770 500 mg QD
group.description: PXL770 250 mg: Oral capsule Placebo: Oral capsule Two capsules were taken BID with a glass of water at least 15 minutes before a meal in the morning and in the evening time for 12 weeks: 2 capsules of PXL770 250 mg 2 capsules of placebo in the evening

milestone.title: Received at Least 1 Dose of Double-blind Study Treatment

analysis.method_desc: ANCOVA model using a multiple imputation procedure based on the fully conditional specification method.
analysis.estimate_desc: Mean difference (final values) is the difference in Least Squares (LS) Means estimated in the ANCOVA model.

outcome.title: Relative Change in the Percentage of Liver Fat Mass (Assessed by MRI-PDFF) From Baseline to Week 12/End of Treatment (Per Protocol Sensitivity Analysis)
outcome.description: MRI acquisitions were performed at pre-qualified local MRI facilities using qualified and standardized instruments at high field strength (3 T or 1.5T) without oral or intravenous contrast. All acquisitions images were transferred to a central reader vendor for central calculation and measurement of MRI-PDFF using the method of Zhong et al. to estimate water and fat components. A 3 cm2 ROI was placed in each Couinaud segment. Central reading was masked to treatment group, clinical data, study site of origin and timepoint.
outcome.population: Per Protocol Set (PPS), defined as all patients in the ITTS who complete the double-blind treatment period and have an overall treatment duration ≥8 weeks (≥56 days) without any CSR reportable protocol deviations (PD) that is deemed to affect the primary efficacy endpoint of MRI-PDFF.

outcome.title: Percentage of Responders (Relative Reduction of at Least 30% in Liver Fat Mass) at Week 12/End of Treatment
outcome.description: Responders were defined as patients who achieved a clinically meaningful relative reduction of at least 30% in liver fat mass From baseline to Week 12/EOT as assessed by MRI-PDFF
outcome.population: ITTS, defined as all as-randomized patients who received at least one dose of study treatment. For patients with missing Week 12/End of Treatment, multiple imputation by fully conditional specification methods was used for analysis, although the n counts and percentages reflect only the observed data.

outcome.title: Change in Fibrosis-4 (Fib-4) Score From Baseline to Week 12/End of Treatment
outcome.description: Fib-4 score is a non invasive method based on clinical determinations that indicates the level of fibrosis/ scarring of the liver. The set cutoffs for this scoring are: Fib-4 < 1.45: absence of cirrhosis; Fib-4 between 1.45 - 3.25: inconclusive and Fib-4 > 3.25: cirrhosis. Fib-4 score was calculated as (Age [years] × AST [U/L]) / (platelet [10^9/L] × √[ALT [U/L]]). Blood samples used for AST, ALT and platelet counts were collected, handled and stored according to the instructions described in the laboratory manual and all measurements were performed at a central laboratory.
outcome.population: ITTS, defined as all as-randomized patients who received at least one dose of study treatment.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Two capsules were taken BID at least 15 minutes before a meal for 12 weeks

group.title: PXL770 250 mg QD
group.description: Two capsules were taken BID at least 15 minutes before a meal for 12 weeks

group.title: PXL770 250 mg BID
group.description: Two capsules were taken BID at least 15 minutes before a meal for 12 weeks

group.title: PXL770 500 mg QD
group.description: Two capsules were taken BID at least 15 minutes before a meal for 12 weeks

measure.title: Change in Fibrosis-4 (Fib-4) Score From Baseline to Week 12/End of Treatment
measure.description: Fib-4 score is a non invasive method based on clinical determinations that indicates the level of fibrosis/ scarring of the liver. The set cutoffs for this scoring are: Fib-4 < 1.45: absence of cirrhosis; Fib-4 between 1.45 - 3.25: inconclusive and Fib-4 > 3.25: cirrhosis. Fib-4 score was calculated as (Age [years] × AST [U/L]) / (platelet [10^9/L] × √[ALT [U/L]]). Blood samples used for AST, ALT and platelet counts were collected, handled and stored according to the instructions described in the laboratory manual and all measurements were performed at a central laboratory.

outcome.title: Change in Body Weight From Baseline to Week 12/End of Treatment
outcome.description: Body weight was measured using a scale with appropriate resolution, placed on a stable, flat surface. Shoes, bulky layers of clothing, and jackets had to be removed so that only light clothing remained.
outcome.population: ITTS, defined as all as-randomized patients who received at least one dose of study treatment.

outcome.title: Percentage of Responders (Relative Reduction of at Least 30% in Liver Fat Mass) at Week 12/End of Treatment (T2DM Subgroup)
outcome.description: Responders were defined as patients who achieved a clinically meaningful relative reduction of at least 30% in liver fat mass From baseline to Week 12/EOT as assessed by MRI-PDFF
outcome.population: ITTS T2DM subgroup, defined as all as-randomized T2DM patients who received at least one dose of study treatment. For patients with missing Week 12/End of Treatment, multiple imputation by fully conditional specification methods was used for analysis, although the n counts and percentages reflect only the observed data.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Two capsules were taken BID with a glass of water at least 15 minutes before a meal in the morning and in the evening time for 12 weeks

group.title: PXL770 250 mg QD
group.description: Two capsules were taken BID with a glass of water at least 15 minutes before a meal in the morning and in the evening time for 12 weeks.

group.title: PXL770 250 mg BID

group.title: PXL770 500 mg QD

measure.title: Percentage of Responders (Relative Reduction of at Least 30% in Liver Fat Mass) at Week 12/End of Treatment (T2DM Subgroup)
measure.description: Responders were defined as patients who achieved a clinically meaningful relative reduction of at least 30% in liver fat mass From baseline to Week 12/EOT as assessed by MRI-PDFF
measure.population: ITTS T2DM subgroup, defined as all as-randomized T2DM patients who received at least one dose of study treatment. For patients with missing Week 12/End of Treatment, multiple imputation by fully conditional specification methods was used for analysis, although the n counts and percentages reflect only the observed data.

reported_events.time_frame: All AEs were collected from the time of ICF signature to the End-of-study Visit, ie 19 weeks on average. Only events that occur after the first dose intake of IMP of the Double-blind (DB) treatment period or if they were present prior to the first intake of IMP of the DB treatment period and increased in severity or relationship to IMP after the first intake of IMP of the DB treatment period were considered as Treatment Emergent Adverse Events (TEAEs). Only TEAEs are presented in this section.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
